text:
Triloki Nath Chaturvedi (18 January 1929 – 5 January 2020) was an Indian politician. He was born in Kannauj, Uttar Pradesh. From 1984 through 1989, he was the Comptroller and Auditor General. In 2002, he became the Governor of Karnataka and left office in 2007. In 2004, he was the Governor of Kerala.
He was an unsuccessful candidate for President of India in 2017.
Chaturvedi died on 5 January 2020 while on his way to the hospital in Noida, Uttar Pradesh of a heart attack, aged 90.
